## Table S1: Full summary of the multi-response model
Hormone levels were logged and centered on the population mean. Intercepts refer to the population mean for all standardized variables (indicated by [Z]), lactation status = not lactating, gestational day = 0, species = anubis, sex = female, blood in CSF = no (for CSF samples only), and plasma lysis = no (for plasma samples only). Thus, an intercept of 0 would indicate that a non-pregnant, non-lactating anubis female of average age and size, living in a average-sized corral, whose sample was not contaminated, has a hormone level that is exactly the same as the unadjusted population mean; a slope of 0.5 would indicate that hormone levels are predicted to increase by 0.5 on the log scale with a change of one standard deviation (for Z-scored variables) or when changing the level of categorical predictors (e.g. going to species = hamadryas) relative to the intercept. For visualization of the date spline see Figure S3. To summarize within- and between corral differences in hormone levels, we calculated the intra-class correlation (ICC) for the corral ID, i.e. the proportion of variance explained by unmeasured factors that differ between corrals; this was consistently lower than the within-corral (= residual) variance

## Species differences and biological validation in univariate models

Results about species differences in hormone levels were similar when using univariate models (Figure S1). Specifically, hamadryas females did not have consistently higher hormone levels than anubis females (CSF OT: median difference = `r round(median(post_m2a$b_SubspeciesHamadryas),2)`, 90% CI = `r round(HPDI(post_m2a$b_SubspeciesHamadryas, prob=0.9)[1],2)` - `r round(HPDI(post_m2a$b_SubspeciesHamadryas, prob=0.9)[2],2)`, PP~hamadryas>anubis~ = `r round(sum(post_m2a$b_SubspeciesHamadryas>0)/length(post_m2a$b_SubspeciesHamadryas),2)`; plasma OT: median difference = `r round(median(post_m2b$b_SubspeciesHamadryas),2)`, 90% CI = `r round(HPDI(post_m2b$b_SubspeciesHamadryas, prob=0.9)[1],2)` - `r round(HPDI(post_m2b$b_SubspeciesHamadryas, prob=0.9)[2],2)`, PP~hamadryas>anubis~ = `r round(sum(post_m2b$b_SubspeciesHamadryas>0)/length(post_m2b$b_SubspeciesHamadryas),2)`; urinary OT: median difference = `r round(median(post_m2c$b_SubspeciesHamadryas),2)`, 90% CI = `r round(HPDI(post_m2c$b_SubspeciesHamadryas, prob=0.9)[1],2)` - `r round(HPDI(post_m2c$b_SubspeciesHamadryas, prob=0.9)[2],2)`, PP~hamadryas>anubis~ = `r round(sum(post_m2c$b_SubspeciesHamadryas>0)/length(post_m2c$b_SubspeciesHamadryas),2)`; CSF AVP: median difference = `r round(median(post_m2d$b_SubspeciesHamadryas),2)`, 90% CI = `r round(HPDI(post_m2d$b_SubspeciesHamadryas, prob=0.9)[1],2)` - `r round(HPDI(post_m2d$b_SubspeciesHamadryas, prob=0.9)[2],2)`, PP~hamadryas>anubis~ = `r round(sum(post_m2d$b_SubspeciesHamadryas>0)/length(post_m2d$b_SubspeciesHamadryas),2)`), nor did hamadryas males have consistently higher levels than anubis males (CSF OT: median difference = `r round(median(CSFOT_hamadryasmales-CSFOT_anubismales),2)`, 90% CI = `r round(HPDI(CSFOT_hamadryasmales-CSFOT_anubismales, prob=0.9)[1],2)` - `r round(HPDI(CSFOT_hamadryasmales-CSFOT_anubismales, prob=0.9)[2],2)`, PP~hamadryas>anubis~ = `r round(sum(CSFOT_hamadryasmales-CSFOT_anubismales>0)/length(CSFOT_hamadryasmales),2)`; Plasma OT: median difference = `r round(median(plasmaOT_hamadryasmales-plasmaOT_anubismales),2)`, 90% CI = `r round(HPDI(plasmaOT_hamadryasmales-plasmaOT_anubismales, prob=0.9)[1],2)` - `r round(HPDI(plasmaOT_hamadryasmales-plasmaOT_anubismales, prob=0.9)[2],2)`, PP~hamadryas>anubis~ = `r round(sum(plasmaOT_hamadryasmales-plasmaOT_anubismales>0)/length(plasmaOT_hamadryasmales),2)`; Urinary OT: median difference = `r round(median(urineOT_hamadryasmales-urineOT_anubismales),2)`, 90% CI = `r round(HPDI(urineOT_hamadryasmales-urineOT_anubismales, prob=0.9)[1],2)` - `r round(HPDI(urineOT_hamadryasmales-urineOT_anubismales, prob=0.9)[2],2)`, PP~hamadryas>anubis~ = `r round(sum(urineOT_hamadryasmales-urineOT_anubismales>0)/length(urineOT_hamadryasmales),2)`; CSF AVP: median difference = `r round(median(CSFAVP_hamadryasmales-CSFAVP_anubismales),2)`, 90% CI = `r round(HPDI(CSFAVP_hamadryasmales-CSFAVP_anubismales, prob=0.9)[1],2)` - `r round(HPDI(CSFAVP_hamadryasmales-CSFAVP_anubismales, prob=0.9)[2],2)`, PP~hamadryas>anubis~ = `r round(sum(CSFAVP_hamadryasmales-CSFAVP_anubismales>0)/length(CSFAVP_hamadryasmales),2)`).

As in the multi-response model, other associations provide important biological validation. Consistent with OT's reproductive functions, females of both species tended to have higher OT levels than males (Anubis CSF OT: median difference = `r -round(median(post_m2a$b_SexM),2)`, 90% CI = `r -round(HPDI(post_m2a$b_SexM, prob=0.9)[1],2)` - `r -round(HPDI(post_m2a$b_SexM, prob=0.9)[2],2)`, PP~females>males~ = `r round(sum(post_m2a$b_SexM<0)/length(post_m2a$b_SexM),2)`; Anubis Plasma OT: median difference = `r -round(median(post_m2b$b_SexM),2)`, 90% CI = `r -round(HPDI(post_m2b$b_SexM, prob=0.9)[1],2)` - `r -round(HPDI(post_m2b$b_SexM, prob=0.9)[2],2)`, PP~females>males~ = `r round(sum(post_m2b$b_SexM<0)/length(post_m2b$b_SexM),2)`; Anubis Urinary OT: median difference = `r -round(median(post_m2c$b_SexM),2)`, 90% CI = `r -round(HPDI(post_m2c$b_SexM, prob=0.9)[1],2)` - `r -round(HPDI(post_m2c$b_SexM, prob=0.9)[2],2)`, PP~females>males~ = `r round(sum(post_m2c$b_SexM<0)/length(post_m2c$b_SexM),2)`; Hamadryas CSF OT: median difference = `r round(median(CSFOT_hamadryasfemales-CSFOT_hamadryasmales),2)`, 90% CI = `r round(HPDI(CSFOT_hamadryasfemales-CSFOT_hamadryasmales, prob=0.9)[1],2)` - `r round(HPDI(CSFOT_hamadryasfemales-CSFOT_hamadryasmales, prob=0.9)[2],2)`, PP~females>males~ = `r round(sum(CSFOT_hamadryasfemales-CSFOT_hamadryasmales>0)/length(CSFOT_hamadryasfemales),2)`; Hamadryas Plasma OT: median difference = `r round(median(plasmaOT_hamadryasfemales-plasmaOT_hamadryasmales),2)`, 90% CI = `r round(HPDI(plasmaOT_hamadryasfemales-plasmaOT_hamadryasmales, prob=0.9)[1],2)` - `r round(HPDI(plasmaOT_hamadryasfemales-plasmaOT_hamadryasmales, prob=0.9)[2],2)`, PP~females>males~ = `r round(sum(plasmaOT_hamadryasfemales-plasmaOT_hamadryasmales>0)/length(plasmaOT_hamadryasfemales),2)`; Hamadryas Urinary OT: median difference = `r round(median(urineOT_hamadryasfemales-urineOT_hamadryasmales),2)`, 90% CI = `r round(HPDI(urineOT_hamadryasfemales-urineOT_hamadryasmales, prob=0.9)[1],2)` - `r round(HPDI(urineOT_hamadryasfemales-urineOT_hamadryasmales, prob=0.9)[2],2)`, PP~females>males~ = `r round(sum(urineOT_hamadryasfemales-urineOT_hamadryasmales>0)/length(urineOT_hamadryasfemales),2)`), and peripheral OT levels were positively associated with gestational day (Plasma OT: median slope = `r round(median(post_m2b$b_GD_DOC),2)`, 90% CI = `r round(HPDI(post_m2b$b_GD_DOC, prob=0.9)[1],2)` - `r round(HPDI(post_m2b$b_GD_DOC, prob=0.9)[2],2)`, PP~slope>0~ = `r round(sum(post_m2b$b_GD_DOC>0)/length(post_m2b$b_GD_DOC),2)`; Urinary OT: median slope = `r round(median(post_m2c$b_GD_DOC),2)`, 90% CI = `r round(HPDI(post_m2c$b_GD_DOC, prob=0.9)[1],2)` - `r round(HPDI(post_m2c$b_GD_DOC, prob=0.9)[2],2)`, PP~slope>0~ = `r round(sum(post_m2c$b_GD_DOC>0)/length(post_m2c$b_GD_DOC),2)`).

## Figure S2: Visualization of date splines (multi-response model)

```{r Figure S2, include=TRUE}
datesplines<- conditional_effects(m1, effects = "date.z", prob=0.9)
library(MetBrewer)
col.S2<- MetPalettes$Austria[[1]][5]

par(mfrow=c(2,2), oma=c(3,3,0,0), mar=c(2,2,3,1))
plot(datesplines[[1]]$estimate__~datesplines[[1]]$effect1__, ylab = "", xlab = "", ylim=c(-1,1.5), type="l", main="CSF Oxytocin", col=col.S2, bty="n")
polygon(c(datesplines[[1]]$effect1__, rev(datesplines[[1]]$effect1__)), c(datesplines[[1]]$lower__, rev(datesplines[[1]]$upper__)), col=adjustcolor(col.S2, alpha.f=0.5), border=NA)
plot(datesplines[[2]]$estimate__~datesplines[[2]]$effect1__, ylab = "", xlab = "", ylim=c(-2,2), type="l", main="Plasma Oxytocin", col=col.S2, bty="n")
polygon(c(datesplines[[2]]$effect1__, rev(datesplines[[2]]$effect1__)), c(datesplines[[2]]$lower__, rev(datesplines[[2]]$upper__)), col=adjustcolor(col.S2, alpha.f=0.5), border=NA)
plot(datesplines[[3]]$estimate__~datesplines[[3]]$effect1__, ylab = "", xlab = "", ylim=c(-2,2), type="l", main="Urinary Oxytocin", col=col.S2, bty="n")
polygon(c(datesplines[[3]]$effect1__, rev(datesplines[[3]]$effect1__)), c(datesplines[[3]]$lower__, rev(datesplines[[3]]$upper__)), col=adjustcolor(col.S2, alpha.f=0.5), border=NA)
plot(datesplines[[4]]$estimate__~datesplines[[4]]$effect1__, ylab = "", xlab = "", ylim=c(-1.5,2), type="l", main="CSF Vasopressin", col=col.S2, bty="n")
polygon(c(datesplines[[4]]$effect1__, rev(datesplines[[4]]$effect1__)), c(datesplines[[4]]$lower__, rev(datesplines[[4]]$upper__)), col=adjustcolor(col.S2, alpha.f=0.5), border=NA)
mtext("log hormone levels [centered]",cex=1, side=2,line=1, outer=TRUE)
mtext("Date of collection [Z]",cex=1, side=1,line=1, outer=TRUE)
```
